content.description: Crack of Fear is a hand crack that gets a bit awkward near the finishing moves. Start working your way up the crack with decent jams until you reach the top. The topout is a bit awkward, and a fall could be unpleasant. Take note that your crashpad will be placed on a 35 - 40 degree slope, so if you do fall, you might slide off the pad.
content.protection: A crashpad and a good spotter.
content.location: This ascends the crack on the far right end of the block. It will be right of Crack of Doom.

content.description: Start on delicate footholds just right of the offwidth. Step out left (the crux), and work your way up the slabby face with a horizontal seem. You can use the offwidth for your hands. Finish up in the left-facing corner using the big blocks to the top. Alternatively, you could commit to squeezing into the offwidth, which probably increases the difficulty.
content.location: It climbs the obvious offwidth that leads up to a massive ledge.

content.description: Do you like slab and crack? Then the Yosemite Block is for you! This area has around 10 or so problems ranging from V0 - V9. While this area does not see as much traffic as it deserves, all the problems are relatively clear of lichen. Give this block some love!
